results.title: Maths for the 21st century
results.brief_description: This video says all the right things about maths and is entirely consistent with Frameworks. It has a Queensland focus (Teachers are a little passive compared to Victoria and the workshop style of Calvin Irons is certainly different). However, it should be a useful stimulus film for schools conducting their own self-help stimulus programs. The first sessions could be run over 5 weeks, hence its impact could develop as teachers progressively engage the ideas. No other credits available.

results.title: Maths at home
results.brief_description: Illustrates a number of ways in which parents can maximise mathematically orientated activities with their children using everyday home activities. Includes sorting and counting in many forms, Monopoly, map reading and cooking.

results.title: Maths alive (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: John Howard and Educationa Foundation for Visual Aids
results.brief_description: Shows primary school children learning mathematics from their own discoveries. The teachers have planned the work after careful observations of the children using materials in their own environment. Experiments undertaken are part of a sequence and show progression, but the children are free to follow particular interests as they arise. Music by Jocelyn Crompton.

results.title: Mathica's mathshop
results.brief_description: Young children learn to recognise, solve and enjoy mathematical problems by putting mathematics in a meaningful context. Viewers are engaged in story-related problems involving numbers, measurement and geometry. Ten episodes of 15 minutes duration dealing with a number of concepts. Based on familiar or traditonal tales, children are given challenges to solve, such as how many different ways can the seven dwarfs go to a picnic if they have two cars. Suitable for Lower Primary students.

results.title: Mathew Brady: photographer of an era
results.brief_description: Presents the history of the American Civil War through the lens of photographer Mathew Brady. This photographic record includes a portion of Lincoln’s second inaugural address. Music by Paul Keuter, featuring folk singer Eleanor Stone.

results.title: Mathematics peep show
results.creator_credit: Ray Eames, Charles Eames and IBM
results.brief_description: A collection of five films, each presenting a mathematical idea. The film was part of the exhibition ‘Mathematica: a world of numbers and beyond’. The two minute vignettes use a combination of animation, live action and photographic techniques to present five mathematic principles. They are: ERATOSTHENES; TOPOLOGY: JORDAN’S CURVE THEORY; SYMMETRY; SOMETHING ABOUT FUNCTIONS; 2N: A STORY ABOUT THE POWER OF NUMBER. Drawings by Glen Fleck, music by Elmer Bernstein.

results.title: Mathematics of the honeycomb
results.creator_credit: Moody Institute of Science. Educational Film Division
results.brief_description: Explains the place of mathematics in engineering and the sciences as evidenced by the application of modern mathematical methods to the honeycomb problem. Includes close-up scenes of bees exuding and manipulating wax.
